an internal cavity which communicates with the nearest 
branch of the common canal - A series of pyriform processes
exactly resembling in form those above described [text?] was
arranged round their hemispherical extremities as the
individual I observed was a young one (the generative organs
not being developed) I conclude that there were young
forms of the langer tentacles. (fig. 36)
[paragraph].37. <u>)Of the Generative Organs</u>. It has been already noticed
with regard to the Cryptocarpæ by Will (in <u>Geryonia, Thaumantias, 
Cytæis, Polyxenia</u>) and by Milne Edwards (in <u>Æquorea</u>
that the generative organs are connected with some part
of the system of canals but they do not attempt to
definite the nature of this connexion. I shall eneavour
to do this and to shew that the generative organs both in 
there and in the <u>Phanerocarpæ</u> & <u>Rhizostomidæ</u>, are always 
portions more or less developed of the wall of their system;
and therefore, consist of the two "foundation membranes" in
or between which the generative elements, whether ova
or spermatozoa are developed
[paragraph].38. In <u>Thaumantias</u> there are four canals radiating from the
centre of the disc at right angles to one another and terminating
in a circular vessel at the edge of the disc. Near its termination
each has a rounded body seated upon it. In most of the 
specimens I examined this body was distended with ova
and its structure was thereby obscured, but in one instance
it was replaced by an elongated [text?] somewhat pyriform
body which on close examination was found to be simply
